"This matter looked into," Charles Rule, acting assistant attorney general-antitrust, told Senate Judiciary Committee's Antitrust Subcommittee. Rule declined comment review continuing. Rule responding panel Chairman Howard Metzenbaum (D-Ohio), asked department acting "what appears clear violation law." "We've long ways go," Rep. Martin Frost (D-Tex.). told Reuters. "We making progress should," said Rep. Vic Fazio (D-Calif.). Members also acknowledged panel's preliminary goal spending cuts new revenues would enough enable government meet 108 billion dlr deficit ceiling set coming year federal law. Budget Commitee Chairman William Gray (D-Pa.), interviewed break lawmakers' secret deliberations, said committee still debating shape overall budget come agreement size precise form new revenues spending cuts pursued. lawmakers said House Democratic leadership asked panel come package 36 billion dlrs deficit-reducing measures. package would include 18 billion dlrs new revenues, nine billion dlrs military spending cuts nine billion dlrs domestic spending reductions, said.
